This is where my boyfriend and I go if we want good Chinese. Its hard to find decent Chinese in Arizona in the first place but this restaurant is actually pretty good. Plus we like the buffet style when it comes to Chinese so we can try different items. Their buffet is always stocked up, there is a lot to choose from and its pretty tasty. The staff is friendly every time we go and the place is CLEAN! Too many times we've been to some buffets that are outright disgusting.
My boyfriend who is allergic to shell fish likes it because he can order tuna rolls and there has never been an issue with cross contamination which is so nice because we've gone to some upscale restaurants and have had issues! The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because I do feel it should be a couple dollars cheaper per person but since its always been so good we'll continue to make this our Chinese restaurant of choice.

Even all menus are regular, common, & ordinary menus, The flavors of each foods that I tried tonight was great. I ate mushrooms with chicken, green beans, seaweeds, fried rice. The kimchi was just OK. 

The price was about $20-ish. For the same price I can get a lot more options at 'other place' buffet such as more dim sum options, big  lobster, sweet pork belly, etc.

They have a huge variety of food for you to chose from at the buffet and they also offer made to order sushi as part of the Buffett, which is a huge plus for my husband. They also offer .99 bud lights with your meal which makes dinner even more enjoyable!

THE HOLY GRAIL HAS BEEN FOUND. High end Asian buffet, Sushi that is ALL YOU CAN EAT, AND MADE TO ORDER!!! YES, that's RIGHT! FRESH MADE! You go up to the dude at the sushi bar, and pick whatever you want off of the menu, and he makes it! YES! wow! Also, the food end of the buffet is top notch! MOUNDS OF TEMPURA. So thankful for finding the great reviews here on yelp!  Prices aren't too bad either - 15.99 on Friday or Saturday night, a bit cheaper during the week, and under $10 for lunch. ALSO if you mention yelp, you get $5.00 off the bill for 3 or more!!! Service was impeccable! Very clean, nicely laid out, etc.. I CANNOT WAIT TO RETURN.
Very cool.  Was there on a Sat nite, very packed!  But it was fun! The kids all enjoyed it. the food was great and it was a nice visit to Phoenix/Chandler!
My kids love this place for their all you can ear sushi. Great Asian buffet. LOVE their ribs. Been back a few times already : )

This place has a wonderful and huge selection and most of the food is great. Considering the selection is probably twice that of any other Chinese food buffet place and about a good 80% of the dishes are very well made and delicious, you won't go home hungry.  We both really loved the food.  They also have a few dishes that are not Chinese, to add variety and I guess for those who want some regular food.  The service was also excellent - cheerful, friendly, from the front desk to the person waiting the tables.  It was a pleasant experience and we WILL go back. Oh - totally reasonable prices too.

Since moving from CA to AZ, I couldn't find a decent Chinese restaurant.  Then I found this place and I couldn't be any happier.  The variety of food is endless.  And having the sushi station is a great plus.  Although the sushi station is quite a wait due to only 1 or 2 people working there at a time.  The mongolian noodle station is also great.  It's different from just having the regular chow mein.  And if you're not sure how to make it, just ask any of the cooks and they'll help you make the right mix.  

Price:  $15 for all you can eat Chinese, and made to order sushi, plus a dessert bar.  You just can't beat it.

The only thing really worthwhile is the Sushi Bar.   And considering you can eat all you want for $14.95, it isn't a bad deal if you like Sushi.

As for the rest of the food?   Let's just say it is very, very average, and not very fresh.   The place is also starting to look tired and worn.   

However, if you rate your restaurants based on the amount of food they serve - and God knows, many people do - you will find Nirvana.

Ugh.. Another Asian Buffet. Wasn't to thrilled to go to an Asian Buffet. So I decided to try the Sushi Bar. There is no pre-made sushi. All made to order and the food was fresh. I was surprised that it was pretty good. Only thing is that you only get four sushi per order.
I also tried the stir fry grill. The food was fresh and I thought that it was pretty good. I was very surprised with the sushi and the stir fry grill. 
I tried the other buffet food and it was normal average Asian buffet food. 
I was a little surprised by the desert. The red velvet cake wasn't dry but moist. The cream puffs had different flavors inside. Not bad but not great desert. 
So overall just stick to the sushi bar and stir fry grill that's probably the only thing worth going to this place.

Nice selection of Chinese food with a mix of authentic and more American-Chinese food. Food was good but nothing really made me go back for seconds. The sushi bar was decent, but you have to keep going back to order more.

After reading all the reviews my boyfriend and I decided to go today (10.9.11) and omg it was the bomb!!!!!. I highly recommend Hong Kong Buffet..if you go you must try the craw fish, sooooo good!!!...I give this place 6 stars! Yum-o!

This is the best Asian Buffet by far.  They even have prime rib and crab legs on the weekend.

My only complaint, make sure you get there well before anytime close to closing.  When they are close to closing time, they don't fill the buffet with much new food.

My first and last time here. Food selection was shockingly small. I went there at 4:30pm today (08/10/16) and there was only one more customer there with me. I ordered lemonade and it tasted strange; like someone added bad water to it. I decided to use the restroom and I was disgusted. I'm a nursing student, so I must admit that  I pay attention to cleanliness, but this place was really filthy. All toilets were flushed, but not properly cleaned on the outside. I paid the dinner price of $19.95 and I left a 15% tip for the girl because she was good at her job. I would not recommend this place to anyone. I chose this particular place because of all the reviews I read in my car prior to entering this place. I wonder how some  of the customers can say this place has a wonderful food selection. And btw, no there was no sushi there. Oh, and one more thing. Music was too loud and they were playing music from the 80s and 90s. I don't mind hearing Madonna's songs, but I'd rather listen to some peaceful Chinese music instead.

Love Love Love this place. Moved to the far East Valley but travel to HFGB at least once a week. Very clean, friendly servers, no dirty carpets (restaurants should NEVER have carpet), food is fresh, sushi is a PLUS and made to order (not premade and old). Check it out!

About as good as it gets for Chinese buffet: Fresh food, dishes that don't make you go "ewwww . . . what the hell is that doing here???", real sushi made fresh, mongolian BBQ, a nice full bar, decor that's modern, sleek and clean combined with friendly and efficient service-- All for less than $10 at lunch. I'm in CentPho but still think it's worth the drive.

We definitely would eat here again.  The servicem  was beyond what you would consider a buffet house.  And the assortment of dishes to choose from was outstanding.  The stations were all clean and the food was kept fresh.  Sushi is isn't just laid out like most places. Here its to order.  A very first class, top knotch establishment.   I will definitely be recommending them to my friends and family.  
Thank you all for a very pleasant evening.

Cold food (that should be hot) is the main problem. It was difficult to try to figure out what food was "hot enough" to be safe. I can imagine county health inspectors having a field day with a thermometer in there! The floor tile looked like a product of the 80's and appears grotesquely filthy. Another issue is that the Yelp $5 check in discount was not honored, despite asking two different folks. Service staff seemed quite disinterested in actually providing service. There was one gal who seemed to be more cheerful than the rest, but she was working another area. Would a welcoming smile and a "hello"kill ya??

I would much rather to to pacific seafood buffet for the same price.

I have been going to Hong Kong gourmet for years now and I'm officially over it. We haven't gone in a few months and we went at 730pm on a Friday. Food was old and not being replenished. I saw maybe two items brought out freshly cooked the entire time I was there. Service was okay. But for what we paid, not even worth it. Very disappointing.

My mom introduced us to this place, over 6 years ago! The food is always fresh and warm, their chowmein is amazing. Also love their spicy chicken with jalapeos and they used to have the best peanut chicken, but they don't have that anymore. Service is quick and there are plenty of choices. Love the sushi bar and my family loves the fresh noodle area where you can pick all your own ingredients and they make it there for you. They also have a great seaweed salad and dessert bar. A family favorite.

Best oriental buffet I have experienced yet. The selection of foods is exceptional. Quality is also quite good.

Update: Went back recently and quality has gone down hill. Too bad this place was quite good.
I was impressed with the place overall,  I thought it was pricey for lunch but the selections and food was good.  Would go again,  service was good as well.  Very clean.

My mom is flat out addicted to buffets, which she calls smorgasbords. They don't have to be good, they just have to be cheap. This one isn't particularly cheap, it's not expensive either, but it is asian so she really likes that. This used to be better. Over the years it's gotten progressively greasier, the selections more limited and my favorite, the crab legs, have gotten much worse. The quality of crab legs they are ordering now are barely edible. Overall, I'd recommend passing on this one.

Little over a year since I came here and reviewed it for the first time. This was my third visit and I definitely enjoyed it. I arrived around 2:45 to a nice friendly front desk crew and a kind server. I ordered a water and got straight to business. The miso soup was fantastic.. Actually mostly everything was fantastic. Some of the stars of the show were nicely prepared spinach, mussels and clams, and there were several different types of chicken including coconut chicken which was fantastic. The only items I didn't really care for was the gyoza and the fried fish. I enjoyed some freshly made sushi from the sushi chef including 4 pieces of salmon, 4 pieces of tuna, and a 4 piece New York roll. For $10.60 after tax for a lunch buffet it is definitely worth it. They also still have a punch card where you buy 10 and the 11th is free.

Best buffet I have ever eaten at.  The food is fresh not over cooked or nasty tasting from sitting so long.  I love that they make their sushi fresh, not that pre made garbage sushi that most buffets have.  I do think dinner is a little expensive at $16 but I have to say their food is not just your run of the mill nasty buffet.  They have awesome service and it smells nice in there.  I love Hong Kong Gourmet Buffet!
Nice staff. Clean resturant. Great place for big groups because it's all the same price. Makes math easy. Food was so so, but consitent on quality and presentation. Would return.

After reading all of the stellar reviews, I was expecting stellar.

The Good:
I like that they have the Sushi Bar.
The expansive dining area was aesthetically pleasing

The Bad:
I just didn't like any of their other items... 

I tend toward less "Americanized" Asian food, and they didn't have a wide assortment, for my liking.

lol this place used to be so good but now it tastes terrible! I would NEVER recommend this place to anyone. All the food there tastes like it has been out for hours. None of the workers seemed to care when I complained about the food. All they did was give me 10% off which didn't help much. most of the workers barley spoke English as well.

When Hoa called and said we were having a reunion of former branch employees at a Chinese buffet, I wasn't at all apprehensive. My normal concerns with such eateries--will the food be maintained at a proper food-safe temperature, is this seafood fresh, how long has the sushi been sitting out, will I be able to make it home before my intestines rupture--dissipated because Hoa knows good Asian cuisine. She is, of course, born to Vietnam and world traveled. 

Let's start with my happiest aspect about HKGB: the sushi. No, it's not the best sushi in the Valley, but they make it fresh for you on site. You can stand there and watch it being make, grab a soup or something else to munch on, or just sit at your table and chat awhile. Afterwards, you can head back for more sushi or veer over to the more traditional offerings of a Chinese buffet: sweet and sour chicken, fried rice, crab legs. 

Now let's review the not-so-shiny aspect: the price. Yes, it seems a little steep that we paid about $25 per person with tip (and I made only two rounds) but when you factor in the 2 hours we spent there, grazing, catching up, grazing, passing Lisette's daughter around, grazing and making plans to keep in touch, it's really not such an outrageous amount to pay. 

If you find yourself in this part of town, craving Chinese and are wicked crazy hungry, give HKGB a shot.

At one time was my favorite Chinese Buffet in town but still can be good.

If you come here there are 3 must items. The fresh sushi that is offered,  at dinner time the bbq ribs and the salt and pepper shrimp.

There is a good selection of sushi that you can order and will be made for you. My favorite is the dragon roll. As for the bbq ribs they are generally very meaty and tender with chinese bbq sauce. For my favorite dish hands down is the salt and pepper shrimp. You may think this is strange but I eat the shrimp with the legs and shell but not the tail. The reason is the shell has all the flavoring on it so if you take off the shell you may as eat it like a shrimp cocktail.  Try it with the shell you will like it. 

The lunch and dinner menu are very different with dinner having prime rib, bbq ribs and a few additional items.

Still a good buffet especially when there are a lot if people so the food turns over so they are constantly bringing out fresh food.
